H0.text: Arthropods are the animal phylum to which bees, wasps, ants, butterflies, moths, flies, and beetles belong.

H1.text: Insects are the animal phylum that contains bees, wasps, ants, butterflies, moths, flies, and beetles.

H2.text: Crustaceans are the animal phylum to which bees, wasps, ants, butterflies, moths, flies, and beetles belong.

H3.text: Cephalopods are the animal phylum to which bees, wasps, ants, butterflies, moths, flies, and beetles belong.

A4.text: Arthropoda is the largest animal phylum, with the estimates of the number of arthropod species varying from 1,170,000 to 5~10 million and accounting for over 80 percent of all known living animal species.

A5.text: One arthropod sub-group, the insects, includes more described species than any other taxonomic class.
